features: ✅【Color Size】Specification: 1.5IN/38mm(W) x 10.5FT/3.2M(L) , Color: White or Clear，This waterproof sealant with a crease in the middle.

✅【Wide Applications】The sealant caulk provides a professional look to the bathroom area and kitchen, keeping your house clean and tidy for a long time. It designed for the home. Caulk is ideal for tubs, toilets, corners, bathrooms, kitchen countertops, basins, sinks, gas cooktops, marble countertops as bathtub caulk tape, molding tape, clear bathroom caulk. Whether it is glass surface, wood surface, metal surface, plastic surface, tile surface, marble surface, our tape can be used.

✅【Sealing and Durable】Clean white sealing tape, high-quality PVC material shower caulking strip, self-adhesive bathroom caulking tape, durable caulking tape is mainly made of PVC material, middle and new nano double-sided tape, environmentally friendly, with Long lasting seal and adhesion. self adhesive tape covers cracks, crevices and damaged corners perfectly.

✅【EASY TO USE】Waterproof Sealant PVC sealing strip with crease design, foldable 90 degree clear or white sealant to tightly seal seams and corners between walls. EASY TO USE AND TRIM: Clean, flexible and cuttable tape caulk. Peel and stick material adheres easily. Daily wiping is all it takes to keep surfaces as clean as new.

✅【After-sale Guarantee】We are committed to providing quality products and 100% customer satisfaction. If you have any questions about self-adhesive caulking tape, please contact us, we will serve you 7x24 hours wholeheartedly!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Looks and works great
reviews.reviewText: Looks great and easy to apply. Sticks well and flexible to go around base of toilet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Should have done this years ago
reviews.reviewText: I just sealed the bathtub and toilet where they meet the floor, and this stuff went on like a dream - and even had a little left over from the one roll of tape. It's thick, but quite flexible and a bit stretchy, so it conforms well to the curve around the front of the toilet pedestal. In an old house like this, the toilet installer had to shim the pedestal to make it level, leaving six or eight millimeters of gap in the front. This hides the gap beautifully.Working in tight spaces, it wasn't always easy to get the mid-line crease of this tape to line up with the junction at the floor. I found that if I folded it in half sticky side out before applying it, I got pretty good alignment. Be careful, though - the adhesive is pretty aggressive, and you might not get a second chance at positioning it after it's made contact.Since the installation is minutes old as I write this, I can't speak to its longevity. It's a good bit thicker than duct tape and the glue seems to do its job well, so I'm not much worried about normal cleaning loosen up the tape or rubbing through it. Based on my experience so far, I'll come back to this whenever I have the same kind of sealing job ahead of me.-- wiredweird

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Take your time with installation
reviews.reviewText: Looks very nice when installed. Neater than any caulking I’ve ever seen. Wrap tape around bottom of bowl and cut it about an inch shorter than circumference. Clean floor and edge of bowl where tape will go. Beginning at rear of bowl start installing by peeling tape cover and carefully mounting tape to floor and bowl. Proceed around bowl to wrap the entire bottom all the way around to the starting point. Using a heat gun or hair dryer on the tape and bowl bottom will make the tape more flexible and easier to work with. Don’t rush it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was fairly easy to install. The directions are good and the adhesive on the tape us excellent and I was pleasantly surprised at how well it stuck to my toilet and the flooring (plank floor). It did not, however, go around the front curve of the toilet like shown in the picture. I had to cut it in order to complete that curve. Still, I am very pleased with the results.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Looks nice but a pain to install. I couldnt get the curve right so it looks rippled and couldn't fit it because the adhesive is real sticky

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: There’s a gaping gap between my toilet and floor that always bothered me. I accidentally found this item and I’m so glad I did. The installation was super easy and the adhesion is very strong. This trim was an inexpensive cosmetic upgrade anyone could do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy install around toilet base
reviews.reviewText: Work in little chunks (maybe 6”) and press the fold before sticking down. When I got to the first curve I freaked a bit that it wasn’t going to lay flat, but a few seconds with my hair dryer and it smoothed out super easy. Make sure you clean and dry the surfaces very well, I even wiped them down with rubbing alcohol. It came with a little wipe but that seemed insufficient to me.I’m not super handy, but the end result was a clean crisp finish and took me about five minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Looks great and gives a finished look around toilet and tub.Take your time and only taking backing off a few inches at a time. You direct pressure to give a good seal, and you will not have any gaps.Happy I purchased the larger roll, so I am finish the other 2 bathrooms
Works as it should, was simple to install, seems to stick to floor and toilet well.

This was just okay. It looks good, and can visually make a huge difference. The adhesive isn't great though and the tape is somewhat difficult to manipulate.It's not awful for small jobs or a quick temporary fix, but for something sturdier I would probably look elsewhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tape does not stick once it’s wet!! Not worth spending the money on!
reviews.reviewText: I dislike this product because I needed something to go around the tub obviously should stick right as it’s in the shower but the darn stuff doesn’t stick when it gets wet! Which defeats the purpose it’s suppose to be strong an durable an stay in tub an prevent water and mold from getting in!! It doesn’t stick NOT WORTH THE MONEY! I need a product that will hold!! Can you suggest one that is better??
Worked great ! Looks beautiful ! I’ll be ordering more like this !

didn't use the adhesion helper stuff, might have to go back and use that on the ends. It took a bit of stretching and re-pulling to get it to lay flat on a curved surface around the toilet but other than at the very back where the two ends meet I got it to lay down and hug the toilet. Looks a lot better than before.
